hook:
27 Pull Requests merged in one week.

We are standardizing video generation and making AI agents first-class citizens.
body:
Here is what shipping velocity looks like at Pollinations.

While the industry argues about closed vs. open models, our community is building the infrastructure to use ALL of them easily.

Highlights from this week's 27 merged PRs:

1. VIDEO GENERATION STABILIZED
We unified the resolution system across models and migrated Wan video. We also added Grok image-to-video support and Alibaba DashScope fallbacks. The result? More reliable video generation for your apps, with fewer failed requests.

2. OPENCLAW IS NOW NATIVE
OpenClaw (our open-source agent framework) received a massive overhaul. It now supports auto-installation, auto-onboarding, and web search models. We are moving from 'experimental' to 'production-ready' for autonomous agents.

3. POLLY GROWS UP
Our internal assistant, Polly, now exposes an OpenAI-compatible API service. This means you can drop Polly into existing workflows that expect standard LLM endpoints. We also hardened security against prompt leakage.

4. UNIFIED DEV EXPERIENCE
We merged the Documentation directly into the Play page. No more tab switching—code, test, and read docs in one single view.

Open source moves fast. We move faster.
cta: Check the new video capabilities at pollinations.ai and let us know what you build.
